comment._content: This is Hanns Heinz Ewers, a German writer. He was marooned in NY and couldn't go home to Germany after the outbreak of WWI. "Germany cannot lose" he said, see New-York tribune., August 07, 1914, Page 9, with photo. "Hanns Heinz Ewers (3 November 1871 in Düsseldorf – 12 June 1943 in Berlin) was a German actor, poet, philosopher, and writer of short stories and novels. While he wrote on a wide range of subjects, he is now known mainly for his works of horror, particularly his trilogy of novels about the adventures of Frank Braun, a character modeled on himself. The best known of these is Alraune (1911)" en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanns_Heinz_Ewers He didn't go back to Germany until 1920. In 1918, he was arrested in the United States as an "active propagandist". I doubt that the statement in the NYT, that he was president of the Society of German Authors, is true (hanns-heinz-ewers.com says that he was co-founder of the "Schutzverband deutscher Schriftsteller"). According to the German wikipedia site the only prize he ever won was in a beauty pageant for men.
